description: Update a scope to add or remove resources that you want to be available for Network Flow Monitor to generate metrics for, when you have active agents on those resources sending metrics reports to the Network Flow Monitor backend.

parameters.name: scopeId
parameters.description: The identifier for the scope that includes the resources you want to get data results for. A scope ID is an internally-generated identifier that includes all the resources for a specific root account.

parameters.name: resourcesToAdd
parameters.description: A list of resources to add to a scope. (dict) --- A target resource in a scope. The resource is identified by a Region and a target identifier, which includes a target ID and a target type. A target identifier is a pair of identifying information for a resource that is included in a target. A target identifier includes the target ID and the target type. The identifier for a target. accountId (string) --- The identifier for the account for a target. The type of a target. A target type is currently always ACCOUNT because a target is currently a single Amazon Web Services account. The Amazon Web Services Region where the target resource is located.

nested_params.name: targetIdentifier
nested_params.description: A target identifier is a pair of identifying information for a resource that is included in a target. A target identifier includes the target ID and the target type.

nested_params.name: accountId
nested_params.description: The identifier for the account for a target.

nested_params.name: targetType
nested_params.description: The type of a target. A target type is currently always ACCOUNT because a target is currently a single Amazon Web Services account.

nested_params.name: region
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the target resource is located.

parameters.name: resourcesToDelete
parameters.description: A list of resources to delete from a scope. (dict) --- A target resource in a scope. The resource is identified by a Region and a target identifier, which includes a target ID and a target type. A target identifier is a pair of identifying information for a resource that is included in a target. A target identifier includes the target ID and the target type. The identifier for a target. accountId (string) --- The identifier for the account for a target. The type of a target. A target type is currently always ACCOUNT because a target is currently a single Amazon Web Services account. The Amazon Web Services Region where the target resource is located.

nested_params.name: targetIdentifier
nested_params.description: A target identifier is a pair of identifying information for a resource that is included in a target. A target identifier includes the target ID and the target type.

nested_params.name: accountId
nested_params.description: The identifier for the account for a target.

nested_params.name: targetType
nested_params.description: The type of a target. A target type is currently always ACCOUNT because a target is currently a single Amazon Web Services account.

nested_params.name: region
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the target resource is located.

nested_items.name: scopeId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the scope that includes the resources you want to get data results for. A scope ID is an internally-generated identifier that includes all the resources for a specific root account.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status for a call to update a scope. The status can be one of the following: SUCCEEDED, IN_PROGRESS, or FAILED.

nested_items.name: scopeArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the scope.
